p: An effective treatment for SAR-CoV-2 can follow one of the following strategies ( 30): (i) Inhibition of functional enzymes or proteins, essential for the survival of the virus; (ii) Inhibition of viral structural proteins, preventing interaction with human cells or virion formation; (iii) Stimulating the immunity of the human host; and (iv) Inhibition of human proteins that act as receptors for the virus. For possible treatments for SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus infection, there are several molecules that could be effective against SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus in cell culture, animal, and early human trials [( 31); Figure 4 and Table 1].
